result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J. Smith Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert J. Smith Jr

defendant.name: Smith, Robert J., Jr
defendant.address: 1010 Peace Pipe Rd, Lac du Flambeau, WI 54538

records.addlTxt: 3:05 PM Defendant Robert J. Smith Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Waiver of right to counsel. Right to counsel explained to defendant.  Defendant confirms that he would like to proceed without an attorney.  Court finds that defendant is knowingly and voluntarily waiving right to counsel. Victim rights legislation has been complied with. Count 1 and 3: Plea of guilty.  Count 2: Dismissed on State's motion.  Rights given.  Found guilty.  Court imposes 3 1/2 years in the in the Wisconsin Prison System;18 months initial confinement,  2 years extended supervision, 211 days credit. STAYED.  2 years probation ordered.  Conditions of probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any counseling or treatment deemed appropriate by agent, Maintain absolute sobriety, No contact with S.P.(1993 ), Maintain gainful employment, Court costs on each count. Any other conditions deemed appropriate by agents.  Probation runs consecutive to current prison sentence being served in Vilas County Case 16CF16 and Oneida County case 16CF174.
Request to proceed prose - Waiver of Right to Attorney sent down to jail for defendant

records.addlTxt: Judicial Pretrial - in court on August 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:09 p.m. - Judge Bloom appears in Oneida County Courtroom, Branch II, by video. Court Reporter Lynn Penfield and Clerk Brenda Behrle appear in Oneida County Courtroom, Branch II. ADA Dennis Brown appears by video for the State of Wisconsin from the Vilas County Courtroom. Defendant Robert J. Smith, Jr. appears by video, in custody. Attorney Adam J. Snavely appears by video. Calling 22CF7, 21CF243, 21CF367, 22CM58. Court statement, notes off record Snavely has requested jury trial for oldest case-21CF243. Counsel agree one-day jury trial to be set. Jury Trial scheduled for 8/26/22 @ 8:30 a.m. on 21CF243. Pretrial conference scheduled for 8/5/22 @ 3:00 p.m. Snavely may appear by video for PTC. Bond continued. 2:13 p.m. adj.

records.addlTxt: Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail with Attorney Snavley by zoom. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Waiver of preliminary hearing.  Rights given.  Court finds defendant is making a knowing and voluntary waiver of right to preliminary examination.  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over for arraignment on an information.  State files information in court and provides copies to defense.  Defense waives reading of information.  Not guilty plea entered by court.  Bond continued. Parties waive conflict of the Court. Court accepts waiver and sets pre - trial on Judge Blooms calendar for February 24th at 2:00 pm.

Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail with Attorney Snavley appearing by zoom. Victim rights legislation has been complied with.Defendant received complaint and Attorney Snavley waives reading and asks for a Preliminary Hearing date and time. Court accepts waiver and sets preliminary hearing for January 19th at 10:00 am.

Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail without counsel. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights legislation has been complied with. Court sets $2500.00 cash bond. Conditions, no contact with S.P. dob 1993. Court adjourns initial appearance to January 10th at 10:15 am.
